data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: a half circle and lines for interesting times 
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:44, 06:00, 07:36, 09:13, 12:29

First of all I thank Nev Rawlins for coding my idea into reality!

There is this name giving half circle. its peak points at the current hour. All full hours are basically just a half circle. Lines inside the half circle indicate the up to five 10-minute-increments. Further lines outside the half circle count up to nine for the remaining minutes. It may take a bit to count the lines but after a while you just see it ;) The two used colours can be customized. 

Design Copyright © 2017 Sam Jerichow
Programming Copyright © 2017 Nev Rawlins
data.title: HalfCircle

data.description:
Free

==Overview==
Introducing Codex: inspired by the watchface in Resident Evil 7 Biohazard. Now you can fight for your survival with a gimmicky watchface.

==Features==
- Animated graph
- 12 / 24 hour time
- BT Disconnect Vibration
- BT Icon
- Battery level
- Accent color is based on the battery level (60%+ Green, 30-50% Yellow, 0-20% Red)
- Line Graph Types: Randomize, Hourly Steps, Weekly Steps

data.author: MainFrame

changelog.release_notes: 1.5 : Fixed a simple anti-aliasing grossness whenever one of the hands aligned at any 90 degree angle.

1.4 : Total rewrite. Dropped overall code size by roughly 50%. Fixed the watchface-getting-squished-by-timeline bug, as well as a bug where the second hand skipped over the 60 second position. Also made positioning a lot more consistent between devices.

1.3 : Fixed a bug where the screen got all scrunched up by the Quick View. I'll probably come back someday and fix it so that it can still be read while the bar is up, but for now the face will just get covered on the bottom.
1.2 : Added support for Pebble Time 2 watches (not that it matters anymore).
1.1 : Added an optional second hand that can be enabled by switching your watch over to 24-hour mode.
1.0 : Initial Release

data.description:
A simple analog watchface that consists only of lines and dots. Nothing fancy, just something nice.
This watchface also includes an optional second hand that can be enabled by switching your watch over to 24-hour mode. It looks nice, but it takes a fair bit more battery. It's your choice. Just keep your watch in 12-hour mode if you don't want the second hand.

latest_release.release_notes: 1.5 : Fixed a simple anti-aliasing grossness whenever one of the hands aligned at any 90 degree angle.

data.title: Simple Analog

changelog.release_notes: Fixed a possible memory leak if disconnected while downloading a picture. Better caching for image downloads.
Stability improvements.
Minor tweak to the text color.
Minor adjustment to the time, date and battery meter position.
You can configure to have battery level in the watchface.
You can disable automatic refresh of satellite images.
Now Blue Marble supports Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel.
Adding "Shake to refresh" so you can shake your Pebble to refresh the picture right away.
Initial release of Blue Marble.

data.description:
Blue Marble sets the most recent picture of the Earth from satellites including NASA's DSCOVR and JMA's Himawari-8.

Since DSCOVR's sitting on Earth-Sun L1 point, the Earth is always fully visible in its images and you can see the Earth spinning. On the other hand, Himawari-8 is positioned in geostationary orbit so it only shows the very specific part of Earth all the time but you can see the Earth waning and waxing.

DSCOVR's images are usually updated in every a few hours and as low as 10 minutes for Himawari-8.

Blue Marble downloads images of your satellite of choice through your smartphone.

To find more about DSCOVR satellite, it's EPIC camera and images, please visit https://epic.gsfc.nasa.gov/.

For Himawari-8 satellite please visit http://www.data.jma.go.jp/mscweb/en/himawari89/.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed a possible memory leak if disconnected while downloading a picture. Better caching for image downloads.

data.title: Blue Marble

data.author: chops
data.description:
Another PTR exclusive.  This has big numbers, that appear as if they are 'bulging' outward from the centre.

A weather icon also appears behind the time, when BT is connected.  It can also be hidden at any time.  The weather icon is set to update every 2hours 
(the location can be set manually) - it isn't the most accurate or up to date weather - it's really just there to look nice and make the watch appear a bit 'smart'.

data.description:
Safe Lock is a premium watchface designed for the Pebble Time round exclusively, priced at 0.60$ + local taxes.   You have a trial period of 24 hours to try out the watch before a purchase is required. 

The following information is shown :
In the middle, the date is show.  Below a battery indicator is depicted.  It turns red at low battery.  The full rings indicate hour and minute hands.  The center dotted ring indicates hour/minute tick marks.

The colored arc on the hour ring indicates the day of the week.  It starts on Monday at the 12h tick mark, and moves clockwise as the week progresses. 

The colors of the date, hour/minute hands and tick mark indicators can be changed on the watchface configuration page.
data.title: Safe lock

data.description:
Powered by KiezelPay: $0.99 + local taxes after 24-hr trial
 
Presenting Retro Digital, a watchface with a simple, yet elegant and stylish retro design.

Features:-
- Invert or colour options, bluetooth indicator, vibration and date format options, battery percent
- Date displays language in user settings
 
Weather:
- Manual or automatic location
- Current conditions and temperature (C or F)
- Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support
 
Health where applicable:
- Disable Health option (from version 1.10)
- Steps, Heart Rate (BPM), Sleep, Calories and Distance
- Choose step goal from manual goal or history
- Meet or exceed your step goal and get *** stars *** !!

Choose either weather or health, and shake to view second option (for instance, if you choose to view weather then shake to view your preferred health item - default is steps.  Available in refresh-per-minute only)
 
Credits:-
- Font: Let's Go Digital under SIL Open Font License from WLM Fonts
 
Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!!

data.description:
This is a paid watchface with a free 24 hour trial. You can purchase it for $0.99 individually or $5.99 for a bundle that includes all watchfaces made by Simply, present and future.

== Features ==
A fully customizable watchface with maximum clarity.

- Languages: English, Español, Deutsch, Nederlands, Français, Italiano, Čeština, Slovenčina, Català, Türkçe, Português, Polskie, Magyar, Svenska, Norsk

- Custom color configuration
- 12 / 24 hour time

- Temperature & Condition

- Alternative Timezone
- Seconds
- Battery
- BT Disconnect Icon & Vibration

- Master Key Support (pmkey.xyz)

Remember to leave a ❤ if you enjoy using Simply Focus!

Simply develops elegant watchfaces with a single focus and creates its design around it. For more information, visit simplywatchfaces.com

Designed & Developed by Elijah Kang

Copyright © 2017 Elijah Kang

data.description:
This is a simple watchface that includes watch battery level, phone battery level (if your phone's browser JavaScript run environment exposes it), a single-digit hour when in 12-hour mode (X, E, and D are 10, 11, and 12, respectively), the day of the week, date, and (when a Dark Sky API key is entered) the current local temperature and rain forecast for the next hour (by minutes) and 48 hours (by hour).

You can set your weather preferences in the watchface's settings. There's no API key (or Dark Sky branding) baked into the build because I pretty much only made this for my own personal use.

data.description:
Sundials have been used to tell the time for around 3500 years.  Now available in on your Pebble.

This does not use the Pebble's compass, but simulates the shadow pointing to the time.  The shadow moves around from 6AM to 6PM, then again from 6PM to 6AM (pretending that moonlight casts a similar shadow - I know it moves differently, but just pretend).

The shadow-casting object, known as a gnomon, changes color between the 2 phases - light brown between 6am and 6pm and gray between 6pm and 6am.  The background similarly changes from yellow to white.


Configuration options:
- Northern or Southern hemisphere (changes the rotation and numbering)
- Roman or modern digits
- On wrist shake, time replaces compass shape at bottom for a few seconds
Note the time shown is in the digit format chosen


Screenshots:  
-   8:30AM animation Northern (Roman/Modern/Modern & time/Roman & time)
- 10:23PM Southern (Roman)
-   9:45PM Northern (Modern)


Design & Programming Copyright © 2017 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: For black&white Pebbles, added option to have a black background with white shadows - the "inverted world" option!   This was requested and looks good - you just have to stop wanting it to look realistic.

data.title: Sundial

data.description:
Vault-Tec 24

A 24 hour analog watchface, inspired by the Fallout video games.

The single watch hand updates every minute. When pointing directly towards the bottom, the time is 12:00am, and when pointing directly towards the top, the time is 12:00pm.

The circle at the center of the watchface represents the minutes.

Also displays the day of the week, month, and current day.

data.author: chops
data.description:
Something like this was originally suggested via feedback from another watchface of mine.

It's quite simple, and if turned on via settings, the full date will scroll under the time - either every minute or via a shake. When it's all turned off, the date shows, and the watchface is a good battery saver.

Most element colours can be configured, and the background can be plain or have a dot pattern. Supports 12/24hr modes.

The speaker icon always indicates quiet time status - on or off.  The + or - symbol represents bluetooth status, on (+) or off (-).
data.title: Digital Ticker

data.author: MainFrame

changelog.release_notes:
1.4 : Deleted 'all' of the extraneous code, leaving a completely 'bare-minimum' watchface. Also, after a bit of research into how the pebble actually uses its battery, I shrunk the size of the watchface down by a little.

Also added Time Round support, so hey, there's that.
1.3 : Cleaned the code up a little. *Should* be completely bug free. Let me know if otherwise :P
1.2 : Squashed a couple bugs involving the way the watch handled 12 hour time. Also added a nice 0 to keep things symmetrical from 00:00 to 09:00.

1.1 : Added 12 hour and 24 hour support. Just switch the setting in your watch, and it should work. Fixed some positioning, so that the numbers don't jitter around so much from one minute to the next. Hopefully no more bugs!?
1.0 : Initial Release

data.description: An incredibly simple, barebones watchface to save as much battery life as possible. And it's black.

Also added Time Round support, so hey, there's that.

changelog.release_notes: Recompiled for my new Pebble 2. Added quick view and step display because why not...

data.description:
No silly animations - no unnecessary information.
Just the time! 

Stymple's key features are:
* optional date, steps and battery state
* haptic and visual notification of Bluetooth changes
* localized date format for all supported languages
* 12 hour format support (triggers american date format) 
* low energy consumption

data.description:
This is a paid watchface with a free 24 hour trial. You can purchase it for $0.99 individually or $5.99 for a bundle that includes all watchfaces made by Simply, present and future.

== Features ==
An elegant watchface with a pure weather experience.

- Languages: English, Español, Deutsch, Nederlands, Français, Italiano, Čeština, Slovenčina, Català, Türkçe, Português, Polskie, Magyar, Svenska, Norsk
- Anti-aliasing for smooth text
- Custom color configuration
- 12 / 24 hour time
- Imperial / Metric units
- Weather powered by OpenWeatherMap or Weather Underground
- Min / Max or High / Low
- Weather Location
- Sun or Moon
- Wind Speed & Direction
- Humidity
- BT Disconnect Icon & Vibration
- Battery Level shown as progress bar
- Periodic Vibration
- Quiet Time Support
- Master Key Support (pmkey.xyz)

Remember to leave a ❤ if you enjoy using Simply Weather!

Simply develops elegant watchfaces with a single focus and creates its design around it. For more information, visit simplywatchfaces.com

Designed & Developed by Elijah Kang

Copyright © 2017 Elijah Kang

data.author: ttmm
data.description:
This is a paid watchface. $0.99 + local taxes. You have 24h trial. Payment is handled through KiezelPay www.kzl.io/ttmmstrings 

TTMMSTRING is extraordinary abstract graphic sci-fi like watch face.Vertical lines from 1 to 9 stand for hours. Slim horizontal rectangle is for 10 and bold one stands for 20. On the right in the middle you can see minutes. + or - is for BT indicator. Lines under represents distance. Vertical small rectangles stand for thousands of steps. On bottom is battery indicator with two 50% squares. In the middle of hours you can set extra information like: date, week number, temperature, HR, activity time and even more after shake.

Weather using Pebble Master Key. BT, distance, steps and battery status, hourly vibration, BT disconnect alert  are on/off. Color presets and customization. Date language localization: English, Français, Deutsch, Español, Italiano, Polski. 

TTMM collection won Silver and Gold A Design Award in Interface and Interaction Design Category. Design: Albert Salamon. Programming: Gregoire Sage. Copyrights © Albert Salamon 2016
data.title: TTMMSTRINGS

data.description:
A stylish analog watchface with trailing arcs following all three hands.

Inner (red) hand and arc is the hour, middle (blue) ones are the minutes and the outer (white) ones the seconds.  

AM/PM shown at the top, in green (left lit half for AM, right for PM).

There are configuration options:
- to switch off the seconds display to conserve battery.
- to switch to a white background 


Screenshots:  
(1) 10:40:59PM
(2) 12:20:50AM
(3)   8:00:20PM
(4)   9:15:30AM
(5)   8:10:45PM (white background)


The design was created by José Manuel Otero, from Spain, and originally appeared in the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   The watchface is published with the designer's permission and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.

The original post can be found here:
https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/11/22/triarch-old-themed-analog-watch-with-a-twist/

You can follow Jose on:
https://www.facebook.com/TTM-Technotimemachine-578290348850436/timeline/

latest_release.release_notes: Added configuration option allowing all Pebbles to switch between black and white backgrounds (black now default for all, including white bezel Pebble Time Rounds).

data.author: Casey Doran

changelog.release_notes:
-add a toggle in the settings panel to allow disabling the weather ring.
-fix a typo in weather settings

Thanks, Jean-Baptiste!

- light face mode (check settings)
- swap between precip and wind with a wrist flick.

-fix a bug where at the top of the hour, the face would constantly poll for weather data.
-I'm very sorry if this affected battery life for any users today.
-fix a bug where date line would break strangely after switching between analog and digital layouts

-add day of week to date line
-bolder colors on clear weather
-tweak layout of some items to better suit the type of watch they're running on.

-fix weather availability
-improve battery performance by reducing the frequency of weather checks.
Cache sunrise/sunset on device, no more ringless displays.

-Fix B&W icon of BT disconnect.
-Add Time Round (Chalk) support.

-Switch to paid Dark Sky key.
-Update weather on load and every half hour only, to save on Dark Sky usage.
-Please consider donating a dollar or two to help offset the cost of weather data if you like this face. A little goes a long way.
On digital mode, use a textual readout of the battery state instead of an unlabeled bar.
Add support for B&W watches.
If weather data is unavailable, at least draw the outer (sunrise/sunset) ring.
Added forecast high/low temps. Thanks, /u/Naito-/ !
Initial release.

data.description:
Digital or analog watchface that shows an eminently glanceable 24 hour weather forecast. Steps and bluetooth connection alerts, too! 

The outer ring is a 24 hour timeline.
The red tick indicates the current hour.
Each additional tick is one additional hour, up to this time tomorrow.
The bottom center is midnight. The top center is noon.
The outer ring turns grey if that hour will be cloudy, or purple/yellow if it will be clear, depending on if the sun is up.
A second layer appears on the ring if there will be precipitation at that hour- blue for rain, teal for sleet, white for snow.
Thickness of the sky ring indicates temperature- the widest part is the hottest part of the day, and the thinnest part is the coolest part of the day.
Thickness of the precipitation ring indicates intensity- a short, thick band of blue means a lot of rain in a short time. A thin, long band of teal means a long, slow sleety drizzle.

Bluetooth connectivity alerts are present. Feel free to email with feature requests- casey@spacewalkpublishing.us.

Weather data powered by Dark Sky. 

Design heavily inspired by Krona Sunlight, an Android Wear face.

Built from Planets, an open source face by Alex Karantza. Check it out if you like astronomy- it's very cool.

latest_release.release_notes:
-add a toggle in the settings panel to allow disabling the weather ring.
-fix a typo in weather settings

Thanks, Jean-Baptiste!

data.title: Luminosity

Added support for Pebble Time 2 Watches.
Fixed bug with Weather icon display for Rain weather condition.
Added customizable backgrounds.

data.description:
A simple and clean watchface with basic weather functionality designed to help you get all the info you need with a quick glance.

Features: 
-Weather info plus images updates every 30 minutes.
-Personalized reminder text via app configuration menu.
-Customizable background colors   -- (Suggested by Kirk)
-Customizable line color -- (Suggested by Todd)
-Customizable text color -- (Suggested by Joseph)
-Supports Celsius and Fahrenheit -- (Suggested by Ian)

This app will likely continue to get updates to fix issues and add future functionality. The main reason I made it in the first place was because I wanted something simple, clean, and good looking so that I could easily glance at my wrist and get all the info I need without any excessive clutter.

Feel free to suggest features for the watchface via email, I may not add every suggestion but it does give me ideas. :)

latest_release.release_notes: Dropped leading zeros from hour, day, and month.

data.author: chops
data.description:
Here the code to calculate day/night on the map was written by David Gianforte, then modified and shared by 'Ben’, then by me. I've modified the design and layout, and added a few different styles of map. 

I first published a version of this 18 months ago, which was a bit restricted in its usefulness.

This update now means the the secondary timezones (NY, UTC, Tokyo) will work where ever you are.  I’ve also added 7 different map styles, for colour and B&W pebbles. As such it will now work for all pebble watches running firmware 3+

IMPORTANT: When you select a new map style via settings and save, the watch face WILL NOT update on its own. You will need to push the MENU button, followed by the BACK button to redraw the map.  I tried a number of ways to get the screen to redraw on its own, but wasn’t successful.

When BT is disconnected, the thin black lines (above and below the time/date) disappear.  The (-) and (+) next to the timezone names is simply to help indicate that the timezone is behind or ahead of UTC.

This update is better (than before), but not perfect.  Timezones are now easily configurable, but there is still more to do. If you are comfortable using cloudpebble, the source is available, so you can import the code and easily change the cities/timezones to whatever you want, via editing the main.h file. A more detailed description can be found on my website.  

If you think you can make the timezones more configurable, go for it :)  feel free to fork the code and make the required changes.  I had a go,  but found that it was easier said than done..
data.title: DayNight Timezones 2

data.description:
**NOTE: Yahoo Weather seems to be not working randomly. Switching to any other weather provider is highly recommended.
***********************************************************
Display the current weather conditions and the forecast for the day by shaking your wrist twice. Optionally you can get the 3 day forecast by backing the project.

Now, displays the Health data based on the time:
- From Noon to Mid-night, step count and step average for the day at that time.
- From Mid-Night to Noon, sleep hours and 7 days sleep average.

YWeather tells you the time in 21 languages: english, spanish, italian, catalan, chinese, czech, danish, dutch, finnish, french, german, hungarian, japanese, norwegian, polish, portuguese, romanian, russian, slovak, swedish and turkish.

Get the info than you want, displayed in the right way.

I'm releasing this latest version to fix the issues loading the setting page and free all the extra features. Special thanks to everybody supporting the project. You are simply the best.

data.author: Teal Dulcet
data.description:
What made Pebble’s classic Sliding Text watchface iconic is that words spell the time, as opposed to numbers.  Sliding Text++ additionally has the day of week, month and day fully spelled out. It includes support for the 24-hour time format and has a menu image, both of which Pebble’s Sliding Text watchface do not have.

Sliding Text++ supports the Pebble Classic, Pebble Steel, Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2 (Aplite, Basalt, Chalk, Diorite and Emery hardware platforms).

Please visit tealdulcet.com to support this watchface and my other software development.
data.title: Sliding Text++

data.description:
Simple, elegant and highly configurable digital watch face. Show some love and give it a heart...help me reach 200 likes!

- Multi language (English, Deutsch, Espanol, Francais, Italiano, Portugues)
- "A" battery rating
- Full color control of 8 color properties
- Optional weather display (when enabled automatically pulls current weather every half hour)
- 14 day/night weather icons
- Weather data from either OpenWeatherMap or WUnderground
- Optional vibration on BlueTooth disconnect
- Fully configurable hourly vibration
- Do not disturb option
- Shows bluetooth and battery status
- Shows steps data from Pebble Health
- Custom settings for daily step goal (progress bar underneath shoe)

OpenWeatherMap doesn't require signing up for any outside service.  

Hope you enjoy it!

v1.0
- Text based watch face with date and battery information

data.description:
Simple text based watch face, inspired by Pebble's Sliding Text. Includes the following features:
1. Battery meter at the top
2. Wrist flick to show the month and date
3. Vibration when disconnected from Bluetooth

This watch face has no animation, which will help prolong the battery of your Pebble. Do press the heart button if you like this watch face :)

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.3
- Left aligned text for better aesthetics

data.title: WordTime

data.author: capsgry

changelog.release_notes: The time is NOW.

data.description:
Battery bar, weather information and le "no connection" icon will be added in near future.

data.title: NOW WATCHFACE

data.author: MainFrame

changelog.release_notes: 1.16 : Added some adaptive positioning for the Quick View notification thingy. Also cleaned up a couple pieces of the code.
1.15 : Added support for Emery. Even though no one has one. :(
1.14 : Final fixes and touch ups. Should look a bit more centered on Time Rounds now.
1.13 : Fixed a couple bugs after deleting the previous update, which wasn't uploading properly.

1.11 : Made some (hopefully) final touch-ups to the positioning code, so as to make it look nicer on all supported devices. Fixed a bug where the screen got scrunched when a Timeline Event showed up (technically not a bug, just an oversight :P).
1.10 : Made some slight adjustments to the positioning code; it should look a lot nicer now. Also, added Time Round support, so, yay.
1.9 : Fixed a bug involving the last update not actually uploading. This should work, I hope.

1.8 : Dropped the code size by another 30% (for those keeping track, the code is now 1/4th its original size.). Tuned the positioning code to keep the watchface in the center as much of the time as possible. Also, fixed a bug involving 24-hour time not centering correctly in the morning.

1.7 : Added 24-hour time support, as well as some dynamic centering to keep the numbers looking nice and clean in the middle of the screen. And you all know how much that means to me. ;D 
Also, I just found out that this watchface is actually really good on your battery. So, yay!
1.6 : Dropped the code size by another 30%. I just can't help myself. :D
1.5 : I'm so sorry guys. XD This fixes another bug that left an annoying '1' in front of the hours. It's gone now I promise.
1.4 : Fixed a bug in the previous patch that stopped the time from updating. Sorry ya'll. :P
1.3 : Complete code rewrite. I cut the code's size by roughly 50%, and optimized it to be even better on the battery. Should run pretty smooth. I think.
1.2 : Scooted the numbers back up by 2 pixels. This is the last time I promise. The numbers are centered now. I'm so sorry ;P

1.1 : Scooted the watchface down by literally 6 pixels. They were messing with me. I'm so sorry.

Also, I'm currently working on maybe installing a settings page, so you can upscale / downscale and scoot the numbers around to your heart's content. Stay tuned!

data.description: This is a simple watchface that doesn't do anything fancy. It uses cells to mimic the seven segment style of most digital watches.

latest_release.release_notes: 1.16 : Added some adaptive positioning for the Quick View notification thingy. Also cleaned up a couple pieces of the code.

data.title: Simple Digital
